string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: A decorated evergreen tree, often the focal point of holiday decorations.
Decorative items, often made of glass or other materials, hung on the Christmas tree.
Strings of lights used to decorate Christmas trees, homes, and outdoor spaces.
A circular decoration made of evergreen branches, often adorned with ribbons and ornaments.
Socks or stockings hung by the fireplace for Santa Claus to fill with gifts.
Santa Claus Hat: A red hat with white fur trim, worn by Santa Claus.
Shiny, metallic strands used for decoration, often hung on Christmas trees.
Round ornaments often made of glass or plastic, used to decorate trees.
Gift Wrap: Decorative paper used to wrap Christmas presents.
Scented or decorative candles used for ambiance during the holiday season.
Wooden figurines often associated with Christmas, especially in ballet performances.
Edible houses made of gingerbread, typically decorated with icing and candy.
Glass globes with scenes inside, filled with water and snow-like particles.
A plant hung in doorways, where it\'s traditional to exchange kisses beneath it.
A calendar with windows or compartments, opened each day leading up to Christmas.
Decorative hooks or holders for hanging stockings without a fireplace.
Decorative figurines or plush toys representing a snowman.
Festive tablecloths often featuring Christmas-themed patterns.
Decorative rings used to hold napkins on the Christmas dinner table.
Greeting cards exchanged during the holiday season, often featuring winter scenes or festive imagery.
